intro: Echium tercianum, commonly known as the Canary Islands thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its spiny stems and leaves, which are adapted to the arid and rocky environments of its native habitat. The plant produces striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae, which includes other plants with similar medicinal and ornamental uses.
